docs.lead_paragraph: The General was sixteen years old. She was a maid of all work, one of the unfortunate tribe specified as general servants, and her home was in a Bloomsbury lodging house, in a shabby-genteel street which abutted on a large square. Not much room for romance or interest here, you think; possibly not, except the every-day kind of romance inseparable from any human life lived honestly and bravely.
